Configuration Summary

Service Description Guidelines

Purpose

These guidelines ensure all service descriptions in the marketplace provide consistent, high-quality information that helps users make informed decisions and compare offerings effectively.

General Principles

1. Length Requirements

  • Minimum: 150 characters
  • Maximum: 800 characters
  • Optimal: 300-500 characters that effectively communicate value and function

2. Tone and Style

  • Use clear, professional language
  • Write in third person (avoid "we offer" or "I provide")
  • Present tense (e.g., "This solution enables..." not "This solution will enable...")
  • Active voice preferred over passive voice

3. Content Structure

  • Start with a concise definition of what the service is: remember this is the description of the specific service not of the class of service
  • Follow with key capabilities or features (limited to 3-5 most important)
  • End with primary value proposition or business outcomes

Required / Suggested Elements

1. Problem Statement

Identify the business challenge or problem the service solves
Example: "Addresses the challenge of managing distributed teams across time zones..."

2. Core Functionality

Clearly state what the service does in functional terms and technical characteristics
Example: "Automates invoice processing through AI-powered document recognition..."

3. Target User

Specify intended user personas or roles
Example: "Designed for financial analysts and CFOs seeking to..."

4. Value Proposition

Articulate the unique benefits or advantages
Example: "Reduces manual data entry by up to 80% while improving accuracy..."

5. Industry Relevance

Specify which industries the service is particularly relevant for
Example: "Especially suited for healthcare, financial services, and manufacturing industries..."
If applicable, mention industry-specific implementations or optimizations

6. Certifications & Compliance

List relevant certifications, compliance standards, and security frameworks
Example: "SOC 2 Type II certified, GDPR compliant, and HIPAA ready..."
Include regulatory frameworks the service helps customers adhere to

Formatting Guidelines

1. Paragraph Structure

  • 2-3 paragraphs maximum
  • First paragraph: Definition and problem statement
  • Second paragraph: Key features and functionality
  • Third paragraph: Business benefits, industry relevance, and certifications

2. Prohibited Elements

  • No promotional language (e.g., "best," "leading," "revolutionary")
  • No pricing information (this should be in a dedicated field)
  • No comparison to competitors by name
  • No excessive technical jargon without explanation
  • No acronyms without first spelling them out

3. Consistency Elements

  • Use standard industry terminology from the provided category taxonomy
  • Reference the official subcategory in the description
  • Maintain consistent capitalization for product features

Template Example

[Service Name] is a [subcategory] solution that [core function] for [target users]. It addresses [specific business challenge] through [key approach or technology].

The service provides [feature 1], [feature 2], and [feature 3], enabling users to [key capability]. [Optional specific use case or implementation example].

Organizations using [Service Name] can achieve [primary business benefit], while [secondary benefit]. This solution is particularly valuable for the [primary industry], [secondary industry], and [tertiary industry] sectors. [Service Name] is [certification 1] and [certification 2] certified, and helps organizations maintain compliance with [compliance framework 1] and [compliance framework 2].

Complete Good Example

"CloudSecure is a Network & Endpoint Security solution that protects enterprise devices and networks from advanced cyber threats. It addresses the challenge of securing remote workforces by providing real-time threat monitoring and automated response capabilities.

The service delivers continuous vulnerability assessment, AI-powered threat detection, and zero-trust network access controls, enabling security teams to identify and remediate threats before they impact critical systems. CloudSecure leverages behavioral analytics to detect anomalies that signature-based solutions might miss.

Organizations using CloudSecure can achieve comprehensive security coverage across distributed environments while reducing incident response times by up to 60%. This solution is particularly valuable for financial services, healthcare, and government sectors. CloudSecure is SOC 2 Type II and ISO 27001 certified, and helps organizations maintain compliance with GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS, and industry-specific regulatory requirements."

What to Avoid - Poor Example

"Our REVOLUTIONARY CloudSecure is the BEST security solution on the market today! Much better than Competitor X, we offer lots of amazing features for an unbelievable price of just $29/month/user! You'll be blown away by everything we can do for your company with our super-sophisticated technology that's light years ahead of anything else available.

We use advanced ML capabilities and sophisticated AI algorithms to detect and neutralize security threats. The UI is user-friendly and our customer service is second to none!

If you want to avoid costly data breaches that could cost MILLIONS, you need CloudSecure NOW! We're working on getting ISO certification soon and we think we're basically compliant with most regulations. Contact us today!!!"

Additional Best Practices

Industry Relevance

  • Include specific industries where the solution has proven implementation success
  • For horizontal solutions, focus on industry-specific adaptations or modules
  • Avoid claiming specialization in more than three industries

Certification Documentation

  • Only include current, valid certifications that can be verified
  • List the most recognized or stringent certifications first
  • Distinguish between product certifications and organizational certifications
  • Be transparent about certification scope (full platform vs. specific modules)

Integration & Deployment

  • If relevant, briefly mention key integration capabilities
  • Highlight pre-built connectors to popular platforms in the solution's category
  • Concisely state available deployment options (public cloud, private cloud, hybrid)
